ratings.comment: Took this online during the summer. Four exams and tons of hw problems. Easy to understand and hw was easy but never ending multiple choice questions graded on completion. Exams were a little tricky bc there was hardly any time to finish and no time to look over any answers all multiple choice. Overall pretty easy and good to satisfy science credit

The bad reviews on here are people who are upset that this class IS NOT AN EASY A! Professor Anderson is fantastic. He has awesome lectures where he explains things in great detail but also at a beginner level of learning. The things he taught in this class stuck with me and have changed my life. Exams are hard though. Really hard.
The lectures are pretty boring and long. The textbook reading isn't necessary for the exams. Exam questions are difficult, but some questions come from older exams which is somewhat helpful.

Overall, Professor Anderson is a great person and is very knowledgeable about the content, but this class is very difficult and hard to navigate. I took this class online, and most of the lectures have videos and do well explaining things, while others are black screens with only audio and no visual representation. This class was horrible online.

I learned a ton from this class that I will take into the rest of my life, but it is a hard class. you have to work very hard and even with a lot of effort, you might not understand it well enough to get the grades you want. Go to lectures, and make sure to study your notes and be on top of everything

I thought this would be the easy class of my semester, but that was not the case. He is a great guy and is very understanding, wants to help you out if you ask for it. However there is a lot of homework that although is very easy to do, it's also very easy to miss due dates which lowers your grades. Tests are way harder than you'd think.

I took this class last semester. It was actually harder than I thought it would be! Although the professor seems like a great guy he gives you SO much information during lecture that you just don't need. To study: USE OLD EXAMS

I know many people who came into this class thinking it was gonna be easy. BEWARE: look at the grade distribution. The homework is easy and lectures are optional (very boring too), BUT the tests are extremely difficult. It's basically impossible to study for them, most people just try to memorize practice tests. Avoid this class, I warned you.

This was the most ridiculously hard class I have taken in my time at UW. I took it online hoping to make my final semester at UW a breeze while I finish up my classes for my double major. SO MUCH HOMEWORK AND THE EXAMS ARE IMPOSSIBLE.

Exams are geared towards what he says in lecture rather than what is in the book. But, if you go to lecture you don't really need to read the book. Homework is easy, it's graded on completion. Do the practice exams from past years and you will do fine on the exams since a lot of the questions are the same.

He is a professor who obviously likes what he teachers and what he does. His chalk board lectures can be a little boring but if you do the homework and go to class you don't need to read the book. The class might be hard for anyone who hasn't taken biology or chemistry. I learned a lot!

Online course and his lecture videos were super boring, if you read the book you will get all the information but it is quite tough so having a science background is a must if you don't want to spend countless hours studying. Homework is easy, tests are hard, test questions favor those in class lectures vs online
